courses.customDesc: Choose one of the following: MATH141, MATH161. Students emphasizing Chemistry, Physics, or Engineering should take MATH 141 and 142.
Choose one of the following: MATH141, MATH161. Students emphasizing Chemistry, Physics, or Engineering should take MATH 141 and 142.
Choose one of the following: PHYS121, PHYS141. Students emphasizing Physics should take PHYS 141, 132, and 133.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D3, D4, D5, or F.

Choose one of the following: COMS 390, 395; ENGR 322/SCM 302; MSCI 401, 440.

Any Approved Elective can go here. Students need 27 combined units between the Communicating Science Elective and Approved Elective requirements.

23-26 Advisor Approved Electives required. Senior Project course cannot count. See catalog for course options.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
